intro: Luzula oldfieldii var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a bluish-green hue. It produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer.
